posts.name: Alejandro Santana
posts.cooked: I’m a low level programmer but im being asked to program a 2 jointed arm to have be able to be jogged and also have preset position commands. everything is running on Neo’s connected to spark maxes. the first motor control the pivot of the arm, the motor has a 16:1 gearbox and a spool on the axle to retract the rope tied to the metal. The second neo directly drives a a belt to control a hand essentially to pivot to allow it to turn up and down to face source then the reef. Im currently doing research, but if someone has a wuick start that would be helpful. Im more on the electrical team, but the robot seem to be finished by the end of this week and I’d like to give something to destress our coach whom is more capacle on the mechanical side. Thanks to all.

posts.name: Val
posts.cooked: Couple of questions: How much experience do you have with control theory (ie PID loops, motion profiling, and feed forward?) What language are you programming in? How much experience do you have with robot programming?

posts.name: Alejandro Santana
posts.cooked: I have basically no experience with PID loops, best thing ive done was pid tuning on swerve using YAGSL . Im coding Java, my previous coding projects were always if button __ set motor speed__. That’s basically why im getting pushed to go farther but programming isnt my passion, i just want to give my mechanical team a chance to show off.

posts.name: Val
posts.cooked:
Okay cool, so I have some more questions and a good starting point.

Questions: Could you send a picture of the cad of the arm? Do you use CTRE or spark maxes? Do you have other programmers who can help you or are you the only person able to code this?

Code starting point; So you have a double jointed arm with two joints that have to have a specific angle set to each Focus on making the subsystem for each joint (don’t use 1 subsystem to control both or any type of abstraction, it’ll be too complicated). The goal is that these subsystems will have a method to set their setpoint to a rotation2d and then the subsystem will handle rotating the mechanism. You can Ctrl C Ctrl V stuff between the subsystems Try to keep stuff clean and read able, don’t put any numbers in the subsystem file itself, put them in the constants.java file The more complicated logic (ie the commands which tell the subsystems to move to angles / presets) will be programmed outside of the subsystem files

posts.name: Val
posts.cooked:
Presets position commands are just an enum (think list w/ names instead of numbers) which hold the joint angles, then when a command is triggered it just tells the subsystems to go to those angles

If your code is public could you send the GitHub link (or share it another way) here?

posts.name: Alejandro Santana
posts.cooked:
We use spark maxes, talon srx and srx mag encoders are available, but we attempt to keep everything using neo’s which means sparkmaxes. I have a teammate, hasn’t showed up to practice lately but he has the same experience as me. I dont have the CAD nor do i think my team has made one due to the low amount of people. Additionally, i havent made an actual subsystem code yet, but everything is run through CANbus.

Here is where the other issue i have is, we don’t have someone teaching us, so makin separate files for subsystems and writing the logic in a different file is outside our old customs. VideoCapture_20250211-194110 1196×1176 203 KB

VideoCapture_20250211-194110 1196×1176 203 KB

VideoCapture_20250211-194110 1196×1176 203 KB

One last thing id like to add, there is more to the system, but id like to learn from this section and then attempt to apply it to the rest.

posts.name: Alejandro Santana
posts.cooked: I’ll attempt to go along the starting point you’re suggesting, but i cant guarantee I’ll fully know what im doing

posts.name: Val
posts.cooked:
Here’s a template that we gave to our new members as an example for how to write a motion profiled subsystem.

GitHub - otter502/turretExample Contribute to otter502/turretExample development by creating an account on GitHub.

Contribute to otter502/turretExample development by creating an account on GitHub.

Here is also a quick slideshow about control theory, just focus on the high level understanding and don’t go into the coding section since they are severely out of date

Spartronics Programming 10/30/2024 During this we can have the falcon + spark max test bed in front of us as a way of giving a real demonstration of the topics we want to show I’ll also create a repo with all the code used for this project so they...

Also look at the revlib docs! I’d recommend talking with other teams nearby you and asking them for help if possible!

link_counts.title: Spartronics programming control theory 10/30/2024 - Google Slides

posts.name: Alejandro Santana
posts.cooked: Will do, thank you! As much for contacting teams near me, the ones i am able to contact are sister teams which have been done the same the past years. Outside of that, i dont have a way to contact anybody else, regardless, thanks for everything

posts.name: Val
posts.cooked: I’d recommend also potentially looking at the FRC discord and / or your regions FRC discord! They often have channels dedicated to programming help!

posts.name: Alejandro Santana
posts.cooked: I only knew about chief delphi, I’ll look into that after a couple attempts
